name: treatment of waste paper to pulp, wet lap, totally chlorine free bleached | deinked pulp, wet lap | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10815/documentation

This dataset describes the production of deinked wet lap (40% water on wet mass) totally chlorine free (TCF) pulp.

From the reception of waste paper at the pulp mill, including paper handling. Other inputs include chemicals for deinking and sludge treatment, electricity, heat from natural gas, pulp factory infrastructure and water for dilution of chemicals.

To the loading on lorry. The dataset includes waste paper handling, pulp making, water clarification and on-site effluent treatment. Outputs include effluent emissions to water, deinking emissions to air, wet lap deinked pulp, deinking sludge and municipal waste. Exclusions: liquefied petroleum gas burned in forklift motor.
Due to confidentiality, deinking air emissions and many effluent water emissions were aggregated into the following groups: chlorinated solvent, aromatic hydrocarbons, unspecified hydrocarbons, non-methane volatile organic compounds (air emissions) and volatile organic compounds (water emissions). Those emissions did not constitute major impact contributors to any damage category (less than 0.2% of the total of each category) using the IMPACT 2002+ LCIA method.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from a deinked pulp factory located in the province of Québec, Canada.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Most data are primary data from a deinked pulp factory located in the province of Québec, Canada. The amount of sludge generated was calculated from a 6 year average from year 2005 to 2010.

exchanges.description:
Wet lap (40% water on a wet mass basis). Initial values of this dataset were given for the production of 1 ton of wet lap pulp scaled to 10% water on a wet mass basis.
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.

exchanges.description:
Sum of multiple waste paper sources. 10% water on a wet mass basis. Data from a deinked pulp factory located in the province of Québec, Canada. Initial values of this dataset were given for the production of 1 ton of wet lap pulp (40% water on a wet mass basis) scaled to 10% water on a wet mass basis. This is why the reference product is not 1 kg of waste paper.
Amount was scaled to 1.

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.

exchanges.description:
Average amount over 6 years (2005 to 2010 incl.) of deinking sludge and effluent treatment sludge : 
- 67.4% to landfarming
- 12.3% to mining site restauration
- 13.5% as input to another process
- 3.6% to cogeneration
- 1.8% to landfilling
- 1.3% to composting
Based on those numbers, the sludge treatments are approximated with landfarming (direct link). Sludge transport to agricultural activities is considered negligible.
